headline: Morgan Stanley CEO is 'rockstar' of bank earnings so far
summary: Bank earnings are underway, with JPMorgan Chase (JPM) and Morgan Stanley (MS) reporting solid first quarter beats. CFRA Research director of equity research Ken Leon joins Market Domination with Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton to take a closer look at bank earnings. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: BNY beats Q1 profit estimates to kick-off 2025, helped by jump in assets under custody
summary: -BNY beat analyst expectation for the first-quarter profit on Friday, benefiting from growth in assets under custody which led to stronger fee-based revenue streams.  The bank's fees, typically calculated as a percentage of assets under custody, benefited from the acquisition of new clients and heightened market volatility that led to investors aggressively revamping their portfolios to cushion against the impact.  Net interest income - the spread between earnings from assets and expenditure from liabilities - rose 11% to $1.16 billion.

raw.headline: BNY beats Q1 profit estimates to kick-off 2025, helped by jump in assets under custody

Net interest income - the spread between earnings from assets and expenditure from liabilities - rose 11% to $1.16 billion.
